content.description:
The route goes up the sloping crack just of the left of

Fingers

. It's a fun and easy climb.
content.location:
This is uphill from the Bullet Hole Boudler and just to the left of

Fingers

.

content.description: Climb easy flakes, cracks, and ledges to the top.
content.location:
This climb is towards the eastern end of the Bullet Hole Cliff Band. The set of anchors is to the right of

Frosted Flake

and just to the right of a climbable crack (no anchor).

content.description:
Climb the crack to a shared anchor with "

Strike a Pose

."
content.protection:
A handful of cams/nuts.

This shares an anchor with

Strike a Pose

.
content.location:
To the right of "

Strike a Pose

" is a crack formed by the block detaching.

content.description: This is a great introduction to offwidth climbing. This can either be done as a highball or a build-your-own-anchor toprope.
content.protection: A few large pieces for an anchor, or a few pads.
content.location:
This route is roughly 30 yards to the east of the

Dihedral

. Start in the obvious offwidth corner.

content.description:
First, if you have any info on this route/problem, let me know. I have no doubt at all this is a familiar face to a lot of folks. I'm thinking by posting it, someone might have more info.

Move straight up the face 15 feet right of fingers. It gets easier as it goes up.
content.location:
It is 15 feet right of

Fingers

.

content.description:
Mariposa has an easy start on some cool, pocketed climbing. Thereâ€™s an unique beta that makes this route way easier (find it out!). A sweet mono and good rail out left makes for the crux of this route!

This might be the most bolted route ever, like a bolt every 5 feet (compared to most routes near Junction of a bolt every 10 feet).
content.protection: 6 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains.
content.location:
It is to the right of

The 18th Hole

. This is the right of the only two bolted lines on the cliff and is near the homes. These are the first routes when hiking from below the cliff band.

content.description: The crux is 8 feet off the ground when changing your stance into the offwidth.  It is very sandy.
content.location:
50' left of

Fingers

you'll see the gaping thing you can hike around just like the other climbs or rap in off bolts.

content.description: This is a short, right-angling crack/dihedral in the cliffband above Bullet Hole Rock. Surmount a small bulge at the beginning and layback a fist-sized/OW crack to a somewhat awkward top out.
content.protection:
Fist to OW. Maybe a couple of stoppers for the first couple of moves. You can also toprope off natural features or a more recently placed two bolt anchor.

Per

Randall Chapman

: this now has a 2 bolt anchor on the face.
content.location:
This is on the small cliffband above Bullet Hole Rock to the right and around the corner from

Fingers

and

Chimney

. It is the most promising looking crack that is visible from Bullet Hole Rock and the road.

content.description:
Start in the small chimney ~15' to the right of

Fingers

. Use smears and small holds to shuffle up the chimney. After about fifteen feet, reach your leg out onto the face to your right and pull yourself to easier ground. This is a good practice route.
content.protection: Top rope off hangers and natural features above or highball.
content.location:
This is located at the top cliff band of the Bullet Hole Rock area just to the right of

Fingers

.

content.description: Climb fingers until the crack seams out and follow face holds to the top.  The face climb just right of Fingers is also very good (5.10ish).
content.protection:
Finger-sized gear and per

Randall Chapman

: a shared anchor with

Bubblicious

.
content.location: This is uphill from Bullet Hole Rock on the upper cliff band.

content.description: Behind the tree on the right, climb the corner to a bolted anchor. The crux is in the first couple of moves.
content.protection:
A handful of cams and nuts.

There is a bolted anchor on the right side of the dihedral.
content.location:
It is on the other side of the tree from Dreamer/

Chimney

.

content.description:
Again, I know this is a known climb. So if there's any info on it, let me know and I'll change what needs to be changed. There is one other picture in the Bullet Hole area that claims the route might be between 5.10 and 5.11, so I stuck the grade in the middle. Let me know if you've got more info on that as well.

Start 7 feet right of

Fingers

in the small huecos, and move upward using small ledges and a couple of mono pockets.
content.location:
The route starts 7 feet right of

Fingers

.

content.description: Start in the chimney, and move right to climb face for ~20 feet.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a two bolt anchor.
content.location:
It lies left of

Fingers

by ~20 feet, just left a large tree.

content.description: Climb either side of the solid flake. Once on top of the flake, there are a few face holds and a nice crack.
content.location:
This climb is on the eastern portion of the Bullet Hole Cliff Band and just to the right of

Dihedral

.

content.description:
Follow a cool line of dishy shallow pockets!

This is super protected (unheard of for Junction)! It might actually be one the most bolted lines ever, youâ€™ll have to see for yourself!
content.protection:
8 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor with chains. Bring long draw for last clip.

It might be hard to retrieve QDs, since itâ€™s a shared middle anchor.
content.location: The 18th Hole is found to the right of the tree near the Upper Cliff band. There are two sport routes found when you hike up from the bottom. This is the leftmost of the two bolted lines.
